title: Medallion, 5th–7th century
medium:
Medium: wool 
Technique: slit tapestry weave
provenance:
Before 1902, Stanislaus Baron collection. 
1902, purchased by John Pierpont Morgan and given to the Hewitt sisters.
description: Square of wool tapestry containing an almost frontal bust of a woman with dark hair knotted at the back, gazing to her left, on a red ground. Broad frame imitating gold set with cabochons and rectangular faceted jewels in blue, green, red and white. The woman is wearing a pink garment with perhaps a mantle of sky blue on her right shoulder; she wears a white band in her hair, which is mingled dark blue and brown wefts.

tombstone.epitaph:
Medallion, 5th–7th century.
5th–7th century. Medium: wool 
Technique: slit tapestry weave. Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-72.
